va: va.a1 kt [ele] dress, wear, put on: ~ saa put on a watch; ~ mkufu wear a necklace. (tde) valia, (tdek) valika, (tdes) valisha, (tdew) valiwa; (tdn) vaana.
valish: valish.a kt [ele] 1 assist to dress. 2 buy clothes for sb. (tde) valishia; (tdk) valishika; (tdn) valishana; (tdw) valishwa.
vam: vam.a kt [sie] drown/sink completely: Mahaba yamem~ he/she is engrossed in love, he/she is head over heels in love with sb. (tde) vamia; (tdk) vamika; (tds) vamisha.
vami: vami.a kt [ele] 1 rush: Hili jambo ameli~ tu hana ujuzi nalo he/she has rushed into this matter, but he/she does not have the exprencience on it. 2 attack, ambush, raid. (tde) vamilia; (tdk) vamika; (tds) vamisha; (tdn) vamiana; (tdw) vamiwa.
vang: vang.a kt [sie] be restless, move about; be troubled. (tde) vangia; (tdk) vangika; (tds) vangisha; (tdw) vangwa.
vangavang: vangavang.a kt [sie] diddle; garble, wrest the meaning: Tulipomwuliza alibaki ku~ when we asked him/her, she/ he just garbled. (tde) vangiavangia; (tdk) vangika-vangika; (tds) vangishavangisha;
vavaga: vavaga.a kt [sie] spread, be common knowledge: Habari ime~ kila mahali the news is common knowledge. (tde) vavagalia, (tdek) vavagalika, (tdes) vavagalisha.

vingirik.a

vi: vi.a kt [sie] be stunted/ underdeveloped: Mtoto huyu ame~ mno this child is too stunted. (tde) vilia; (tdek) vilika; (tds) viza.
vibaya: vibaya kl bad, wrong: Leo nina homa, najisikia ~ I have fever today, I am not feeling well; Umefanya ~ kumtukana You were wrong to abuse him/her.
vigavig: vigavig.a1 kt [sie] worry, harass, dragoon. (tde) vigiavigia; (tdk) vigikavigika; (tds) vigisha-vigisha.
vigaviga: vigaviga2 kl not easy, difficult: Ni ~ kwangu kutenda mambo kama hayo It is not easy for me to do so.
vimb: vimb.a1 kt [ele] 1 expand, swell: Uso wangu ume~ my face is swollen. 2 frown, bristle up. 3 become too fat, be bloated. (tde) vimbia; (tdk) vimbika; (tdn) vimbana; (tds) vimbisha; (tdw) vimbwa.
vimbiw: vimbiw.a kt [ele] be bloated, have indigestion: Alikula mpaka aka~ he/she overate.
vimbizi: vimbizi nm [i-/zi-] pain from overeating or from eating greedily.
vinginevyo:
vinginevyo kl otherwise, if not, or

PREPENDED else.
viny: viny.a kt [ele] 1 dandle. 2 tremble, twitch; waggle: Ali-kuwa amekasirika sana, mdomo ukawa unam~ he was so angry that his mouth twitched. (tde) vinyia; (tdk) vinyika; (tds) vinyisha; (tdw) vinywa.
viring: viring.a kt [ele] round; coil: ~ tonge make a ball of food. (tde) viringia; (tdk) viringika; (tdn) viringana; (tds) viringisha; (tdw) viringwa.
viringan: viringan.a kt [sie] coil; become round. (ms) Ame~ he is well built.(tde) viringania; (tdk) viri-nganika; (tds) viringanisha.
viringish: viringish.a kt [ele] roll, rollover, circle around, wrap up. (tde) viringishia; (tdk) viringishika; (tdn) viringishana; (tdw) viri-ngishwa.
vish:
vish.a kt [ele] assist to wear, dress sb. (tde) vishia; (tdk) vishika;

PREPENDED (tdn) vishana; (tdw) vishwa.
visivyo:
visivyo kl erroneously, not in the

PREPENDED right way: Umenielewa ~ you have misunderstood me; Ume-kwenda ~ you have taken the wrong route/direction.

vitimbi: vitimbi nm [vi-] unusual actions, bizarre acts; odd/peculiar be-haviour.
vivi: vivi kl ~ hivi just like that: Aliondoka ~ hivi bila viatu he/she left barefooted.
vivizi: vivizi.a kt [ele] blow with a mouth/pump etc. (tde) vivizilia, (tdek) vivizilika; (tdn) viviziana; (tds) vivizisha; (tdw) viviziwa.
vivu: vivu kv idle, lazy: Mtu huyu ni m~ sana this person is very lazy.
viz: viz.a1 kt [ele] 1 stunt, stanch, under-develop, retard, cut short, keep back. 2 curse, destroy: Mungu akuvize may God curse you. (tde) vizia; (tdk) vizika; (tdn) vizana; (tds) vizisha; (tdw) vizwa.
vizuri: vizuri kl good, well, okay: Mambo yote yamekwenda ~ everything went well.
vuat: vuat.a kt [ele] 1 put between the teeth and the lower lip. 2 blot. (nh) ~ ulimi keep quiet. (tde) vuatia; (tdk) vuatika; (tds) vuatisha; (tdw) vuatwa.
vuaz: vuaz.a kt [ele] 1 cut, slash. 2 hurt: Maneno yako yameni ~ I am hurt by your statement. (tde) vuazia; (tdk) vuazika; (tdn) vuazana; (tds) vuazisha; (tdw) vuazwa.
vugo: vugo nm [i-/zi-] 1 women�s horn-dance. 2 horn used in the dance.
vugu: vugu.a kt [sie] cross, peer out, break through the forest/clouds. (tde) vugulia, (tdek) vugulika, (tdes) vugulisha.
vuguvugu: vuguvugu1 kv warm, tepid, lukewarm, mild: Maji ~ warm water, lukewarm water.
vuguvugu<sup>2</sup>: vuguvugu2 nm [i-/zi-] movement, activity: ~ la siasa political activity; ~ la mapinduzi revolutionary movement.
vuj: vuj.a kt [sie] leak, ooze out, seep: Paa la nyumba lina~ the roof is leaking. (tde) vujia, (tdew) vujiwa;(tdk) vujika, (tds) vujisha.
vuk: vuk.a kt [ele] cross (over): ~ mto cross a river; ~ barabara cross a road. (nh) ~ mpaka go too far. (tde) vukia; (tdk) vukika; (tdn) vukana; (tds) vukisha; (tdw) vukwa.
vuli: vuli nm [i-/zi-] short rainy season: Mvua za ~ short rains.
vulio: vulio nm ma- [li-/ya-] 1 used clothes. 2 slough; snake�s cast skin.
vum: vum.a kt [sie/ele] 1 roar, growl. 2 spread: Habari hizi zime~ mji mzima the news has spread all over the town. 3 jeer. 4 blow. (tde) vumia; (tdk) vumika; (tds) vumisha.

vut: vut.a kt [ele] 1 pull, draw, drag; stretch. 2 attract, charm, entice, tempt, allure. (nh) ~ sigara smoke a cigarette; ~ pumzi inhale; vutia roho struggle for breath. (tde) vutia; (tdk) vutika; (tdn) vutana; (tds) vutisha; (tdw) vutwa.
